CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 9, 1950, pg. 17 reads: "Shut-Ins Remembered at Leech Farm - More than 450 patients were recently made happy when representatives from the Young People's Department of the Women's Missionary Society made, and presented to them, favors.  The group has been distributing the tokens of good will for four years.  Left, the babies were not overlooked.  Pictured, left to right: Misses Juanita Hedgeman, Ruby Conley, Mildred Barbour, Alberta Hughey and Miss Willa McClellan, R.N....-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Five women, including members of the Young People's Department of the Women's Missionary Society, left to right: Juanita Hedgeman, Ruby Conley, Mildred Barbour, Alberta Hughey, and Willa McClellan, R.N., standing around hospital cribs with two small children holding on to rails
